question: Where did Caro, Bravo, and Putte live?
answer1: Caro lived in the dog house, Bravo in the stable, Putte with the stableman.

question: Where did Kuckeliku live?
answer1: in the hen house

question: How old was Walter?
answer1: six years old

question: What couldn't Walter do?
answer1: read

question: How was Walter brave?
answer1: hunted wolves

question: Who did Walter wrestle with?
answer1: Klas Bogenstrom or Frithiof Waderfelt

question: Why was Walter pleased?
answer1: heard that there were a great many wolves in the wood

question: How did Walter prepare for a real wolf hunt?
answer1: took with him his drum, and his tin sabre

question: What did Walter arm himself with for the wolf hunt?
answer1: his pop-gun, his bow, and his air-pistol

question: Why did Walter have a red cock's feather to put in his cap?
answer1: to make himself look fierce

question: Why was Walter's tin sabre a little broken?
answer1: He had with incredible courage fought his way through a whole unfriendly army of gooseberry bushes.

question: Why did Walter's drum have holes in one end?
answer1: He had climbed up on it to reach a cluster of rowan berries.

question: Why was it a good thing that Jonas was going with corn to the mill?
answer1: Walter got a seat on the load.

question: Where did Walter and Jonas go?
answer1: the wood

question: What did Walter do after they came into the wood?
answer1: looked cautiously around him to see perchance there was a wolf in the bushes

question: Why did Walter start beating his drum?
answer1: Jonas said wolves were scared of a drum.
answer2: Jonas told him wolves were afraid of a drum.

question: What did Walter ask Jonas when they came to the mill?
answer1: if there had been any wolves in the neighbourhood lately

question: What did the wolves eat last night?
answer1: their fattest ram

question: Why did Walter ask if there were many wolves?
answer1: He did not know if he should take Jonas with him.
answer2: He needed to know if he needed Jonas with him.

question: Why did Walter decide for Jonas to come with him?
answer1: There could be many wolves.
answer2: He could have trouble killing the wolves if there were many of them.

question: How many wolves could Walter hunt by himself?
answer1: three

question: Why couldn't Walter hunt more than three wolves?
answer1: He might not have time to kill them all before they ran away.

question: How many wolves did Jonas think there were?
answer1: not be more than two

question: Why didn't Jonas want to hunt wolves with Walter?
answer1: He believed Walter could hunt the wolves by himself.
answer2: He did not think there were more than two wolves that Walter needed to hunt.

question: Why did Walter still want Jonas to come with him even if there were only two wolves?
answer1: Walter was worried one of them might bite his leg.
answer2: Walter was concerned that his left hand was not as strong as his right.

question: What did Jonas call Walter after he did not want to hunt wolves by himself?
answer1: a coward

question: What was Walter worried about the wolves tearing?
answer1: his new trousers

question: Who did Jonas want Walter to go with while he hunted wolves?
answer1: the miller's little Lisa

question: Why didn't Walter want Lisa to come with him?
answer1: He was worried she would be frightened.
answer2: He thought she could not help him.

question: What did Jonas want Lisa to do if she went with Walter?
answer1: sit on a stone and look on

question: What did Walter offer Jonas if he went with him?
answer1: the wolf's skin

question: Why did Walter want someone to come with him to wolf-hunting?
answer1: He only wanted someone who would see how he struck the wolf and how the dust flew out of his skin.

question: How did Walter feel after Jonas said he was frightened?
answer1: mad

question: What did Walter do after Jonas hurt his pride?
answer1: took his drum, sabre, cock's feather, clasp-knife, pop-gun and air-pistol, and went off quite alone to the wood to hunt wolves

question: Why did Walter beat his drum?
answer1: He thought there was a wolf.
answer2: He wanted to scare the wolf away.

question: What happened after Walter beat his drum?
answer1: A crow flew up from the ditch.

question: Why did Walter go to the kiln?
answer1: He wanted to go where the ram was killed.
answer2: The miller told him that was where the wolves killed his ram.

question: How did Walter feel after he went near the kiln?
answer1: scared

question: What happened after Walter beat his drum again near the kiln?
answer1: It sounded horrid, and an echo came out from the kiln that seemed almost like the howl of a wolf.

question: What did Walter want to do after he felt scared?
answer1: go back and say that he struck one wolf and it escaped

question: Why did Walter decide not to lie?
answer1: He believed telling a lie was a sin.

question: Why did Walter think the wolves were coming?
answer1: He heard a howl of a wolf.
answer2: He heard an echo that sounded like a howl of a wolf.

question: What happened after Walter heard the howl of a wolf?
answer1: A shaggy, reddish-brown wolf's head looked out from under the kiln!

question: What did Walter do after he saw a wolf's head?
answer1: threw his drum far away, took to his heels and ran. He ran as fast as he could back to the mill

question: What happened after Walter ran away?
answer1: The wolf ran after him.

question: How did Walter feel while the wolf chased after him?
answer1: terrified

question: How was the wolf friendly?
answer1: He certainly jumped on to Walter, but he only shook his coat and rubbed his nose against his face.

question: Why did Jonas run and help Walter up?
answer1: Jonas heard his cry of distress.

question: Who was the friendly wolf?
answer1: Caro

question: What did Caro find in the kiln?
answer1: leg of the ram

question: How did Walter feel after he realized the wolf was his dog?
answer1: very foolish

question: What advice did Jonas give to Walter?
answer1: boast a little less

question: What did Walter want to fight with next?
answer1: bears
